batchSize.description: Number of messages to process in each batch (default: 50)

batch_delete_emails.description: Permanently deletes multiple emails in batches

messageIds.description: List of message IDs to delete

batchSize.description: Number of messages to process in each batch (default: 50)

messageListVisibility.description: Whether to show or hide the label in the message list

labelListVisibility.description: Visibility of the label in the label list

labelListVisibility.description: Visibility of the label in the label list

negatedQuery.description: Text that must NOT be present

hasAttachment.description: Whether to match emails with attachments

addLabelIds.description: Label IDs to add to matching emails

removeLabelIds.description: Label IDs to remove from matching emails

forward.description: Email address to forward matching emails to

create_filter_from_template.description: Creates a filter using a pre-defined template for common scenarios

API-get-user.description:
Notion | Retrieve a user
Error Responses:
400: 400

API-get-users.description:
Notion | List all users
Error Responses:
400: 400

start_cursor.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

API-get-self.description:
Notion | Retrieve your token's bot user
Error Responses:
400: Bad request

API-post-search.description:
Notion | Search by title
Error Responses:
400: Bad request

query.description: The text that the API compares page and database titles against.

sort.description: A set of criteria, `direction` and `timestamp` keys, that orders the results. The **only** supported timestamp value is `"last_edited_time"`. Supported `direction` values are `"ascending"` and `"descending"`. If `sort` is not provided, then the most recently edited results are returned first.

direction.description: The direction to sort. Possible values include `ascending` and `descending`.

timestamp.description: The name of the timestamp to sort against. Possible values include `last_edited_time`.

filter.description: A set of criteria, `value` and `property` keys, that limits the results to either only pages or only data sources. Possible `value` values are `"page"` or `"data_source"`. The only supported `property` value is `"object"`.

value.description: The value of the property to filter the results by.  Possible values for object type include `page` or `data_source`.  **Limitation**: Currently the only filter allowed is `object` which will filter by type of object (either `page` or `data_source`)

property.description: The name of the property to filter by. Currently the only property you can filter by is the object type.  Possible values include `object`.   Limitation: Currently the only filter allowed is `object` which will filter by type of object (either `page` or `data_source`)

start_cursor.description: A `cursor` value returned in a previous response that If supplied, limits the response to results starting after the `cursor`. If not supplied, then the first page of results is returned. Refer to [pagination](https://developers.notion.com/reference/intro#pagination) for more details.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list to include in the response. Maximum: `100`.

API-get-block-children.description:
Notion | Retrieve block children
Error Responses:
400: Bad request

start_cursor.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

API-patch-block-children.description:
Notion | Append block children
Error Responses:
400: Bad request

block_id.description: Identifier for a [block](ref:block). Also accepts a [page](ref:page) ID.

children.description: Child content to append to a container block as an array of [block objects](ref:block)

after.description: The ID of the existing block that the new block should be appended after.

API-retrieve-a-block.description:
Notion | Retrieve a block
Error Responses:
400: Bad request

API-update-a-block.description:
Notion | Update a block
Error Responses:
400: Bad request

type.description: The [block object `type`](ref:block#block-object-keys) value with the properties to be updated. Currently only `text` (for supported block types) and `checked` (for `to_do` blocks) fields can be updated.

archived.description: Set to true to archive (delete) a block. Set to false to un-archive (restore) a block.

API-delete-a-block.description:
Notion | Delete a block
Error Responses:
400: Bad request

API-retrieve-a-page.description:
Notion | Retrieve a page
Error Responses:
400: Bad request

filter_properties.description: A list of page property value IDs associated with the page. Use this param to limit the response to a specific page property value or values. To retrieve multiple properties, specify each page property ID. For example: `?filter_properties=iAk8&filter_properties=b7dh`.

API-patch-page.description:
Notion | Update page properties
Error Responses:
400: Bad request

page_id.description: The identifier for the Notion page to be updated.

properties.description: The property values to update for the page. The keys are the names or IDs of the property and the values are property values. If a page property ID is not included, then it is not changed.

in_trash.description: Set to true to delete a block. Set to false to restore a block.

icon.description: A page icon for the page. Supported types are [external file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object) or [emoji object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/emoji-object).

cover.description: A cover image for the page. Only [external file objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object) are supported.

API-post-page.description:
Notion | Create a page
Error Responses:
400: Bad request

children.description: The content to be rendered on the new page, represented as an array of [block objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/block).

icon.description: The icon of the new page. Either an [emoji object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/emoji-object) or an [external file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object)..

cover.description: The cover image of the new page, represented as a [file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object).

API-retrieve-a-page-property.description:
Notion | Retrieve a page property item
Error Responses:
400: Bad request

page_size.description: For paginated properties. The max number of property item objects on a page. The default size is 100

API-retrieve-a-comment.description:
Notion | Retrieve comments
Error Responses:
400: Bad request

block_id.description: Identifier for a Notion block or page

start_cursor.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

API-create-a-comment.description:
Notion | Create comment
Error Responses:
400: Bad request

parent.description: The page that contains the comment

data_source_id.description: Identifier for a Notion data source (database)

filter_properties.description: A list of page property value IDs to limit the response

filter.description: Filter conditions for querying the data source

Error Responses:

google_search.description: Tool to perform web searches via Serper API and retrieve rich results. It is able to retrieve organic search results, people also ask, related searches, and knowledge graph.

gl.description: Optional region code for search results in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format (e.g., 'us')

hl.description: Optional language code for search results in ISO 639-1 format (e.g., 'en')

location.description: Optional location for search results (e.g., 'SoHo, New York, United States', 'California, United States')

tbs.description: Time-based search filter ('qdr:h' for past hour, 'qdr:d' for past day, 'qdr:w' for past week, 'qdr:m' for past month, 'qdr:y' for past year)

page.description: Page number of results to return (default: 1)

autocorrect.description: Whether to autocorrect spelling in query

scrape.description: Tool to scrape a webpage and retrieve the text and, optionally, the markdown content. It will retrieve also the JSON-LD metadata and the head metadata.

url.description: The URL of the webpage to scrape.

search.description: Search for files in Google Drive

pageToken.description: Token for next page of results

createTextFile.description: Create a new text or markdown file

updateTextFile.description: Update an existing text or markdown file

fileId.description: ID of the file to update

createFolder.description: Create a new folder in Google Drive

parent.description: Optional parent folder ID or path

listFolder.description: List contents of a folder (defaults to root)

deleteItem.description: Move a file or folder to trash (can be restored from Google Drive trash)

itemId.description: ID of the item to delete
ID of the item to rename
ID of the item to move

getGoogleSheetContent.description: Get content of a Google Sheet with cell information

formatGoogleSheetCells.description: Format cells in a Google Sheet (background, borders, alignment)

formatGoogleSheetText.description: Apply text formatting to cells in a Google Sheet

formatGoogleSheetNumbers.description: Apply number formatting to cells in a Google Sheet

setGoogleSheetBorders.description: Set borders for cells in a Google Sheet

mergeGoogleSheetCells.description: Merge cells in a Google Sheet

addGoogleSheetConditionalFormat.description: Add conditional formatting to a Google Sheet

format.description: Format to apply when condition is true

createGoogleSlides.description: Create a new Google Slides presentation

updateGoogleSlides.description: Update an existing Google Slides presentation

slides.description: Array of slide objects to replace existing slides

formatGoogleDocText.description: Apply text formatting to a range in a Google Doc

formatGoogleDocParagraph.description: Apply paragraph formatting to a range in a Google Doc

getGoogleDocContent.description: Get content of a Google Doc with text indices for formatting

getGoogleSlidesContent.description: Get content of Google Slides with element IDs for formatting

formatGoogleSlidesText.description: Apply text formatting to elements in Google Slides

objectId.description: Object ID of the text element

formatGoogleSlidesParagraph.description: Apply paragraph formatting to text in Google Slides

objectId.description: Object ID of the text element

pageObjectIds.description: Array of slide IDs to update

createGoogleSlidesTextBox.description: Create a text box in Google Slides

createGoogleSlidesShape.description: Create a shape in Google Slides
